name: Monsters And Other Wild Creatures Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: A creature known as "ogopogo" is said to reside within a lake that is found in what area?
questions.explanation:
Canada.

	The creature resides in Lake Okanagan in the British Columbia section of Canada. It is apparently a sea creature (along the lines of the Loch Ness Monster.)

questions.text: A creature known as a "chupacabra" has allegedly been preying on wild animals. What sort of creature is a chupacabra?
options: Lives on land, sea and air
questions.explanation:
Land creature.

	"Chupas" have apparently been seen in Puerto Rico, parts of the U.S. and in Latin America. They prey upon livestock and other animals. Tales of their attacks are relatively recent.

questions.text: A creature known as "Mothman" is said to have been responsible for a disaster in West Virginia. What type of disaster was it?
questions.explanation:
Collapse of a bridge.

	The book "Mothman Prophecies" was turned into a movie with Richard Gere not too long ago. The creature is said to be airborne - hence the name.

questions.text: The "Abominable Snowman" is primarily said to inhabit what mountain range?
questions.explanation:
Himalayas.

	Mountain climbing expeditions have caught tantalizing glimpses, seen footprints, heard sounds and smelled odd aromas.

questions.text: A primitive creature known as a coelecanth - thought to be extinct for millions of years - was captured alive in the twentieth century. What type of creature was it?
options: Able to live and travel  in land, sea and air
questions.explanation:
Sea dweller.

	It was fished out of the waters off the coast of Africa. If one creature who was thought to be long extinct could survive until modern times ...

questions.text: The first extraordinary tale of UFO contact in modern times may be the story told by Betty and Barney Hill. Which claim is most representative of their story?
options: Taken by UFO aliens to another planet
Sighting of aliens from a UFO
questions.explanation:
Taken aboard a UFO.

	The Hills were an inter-racial couple who, under hypnosis, describedan encounter with a UFO in New England - an encounter which included  being taken aboard.

questions.text: Which of the following is associated with aliens and UFOs?
questions.explanation:
Allagash.

	"Yeti" is descriptive of the Abominable Snowman. "Sasquatch" is another name for Bigfoot. Okanagan is the name of the Lake where Ogopogo is said to reside.

questions.text: The Loch Ness monster is famous. Where is Loch Ness?
questions.explanation:
Scotland.

	Some have seen "Nessie" by chance; most who have gone looking for a glimpse have been unsuccessful.

questions.text: "Bigfoot" sightings occur primarily in what part of the U.S.?
questions.explanation:
Northwest.

	The creature seems to prefer the Pacific Northwest of the U.S.

questions.text: Which of these names is NOT associated with the Roswell incident?
questions.explanation:
John Sherpa.

	Marcel was the military man who was actively involved in the investigation - and offered the "weather balloon" story (that he later recanted). Brazel is the rancher who first discovered much of the debris. Morris is the mortician who has told a fascinating story about a visit to the Air Force Base after the crash. The Sherpa are the people who inhabit the area where the Abominable Snowman is often sighted.
